thread.title: Struggling Australian couple spent last $11 on a $1 million winning Lotto ticket
thread.title_full: Struggling Australian couple spent last $11 on a $1 million winning Lotto ticket

title: Struggling Australian couple spent last $11 on a $1 million winning Lotto ticket
text:
Dad jailed for suffocating his toddler daughter Struggling Australian couple spent last $11 on a $1 million winning Lotto ticket Last updated 11:33, February 22 2017 FAIRFAX MEDIA 
Two struggling Aussie pensioners won $1m after using the last of their money on Lotto. 
Two Australian pensioners used their last A$11 (NZ$11.80) in change to buy what became a winning Lotto ticket. 
The self-described battlers – a couple from Western Australia in their 60s – purchased the ticket only after the wife dreamt she had won Lotto. 
Just days later the Port Kennedy woman found she had scooped the A$1 million Division One prize. 
"When you're living pension to pension it isn't easy," the wife said. 
READ MORE: 
"I was surprised my hubby let me use our last bit of change to buy the ticket but it was a 'Double Win Day'. 
The woman was checking the numbers as they were drawn. 
"I didn't know what to do," she said. 
"I wanted to tell my husband straight away but I was scared the shock of it would give him a heart attack." 
The woman decided it was safer to warm him husband up ... first telling him they had won a couple of thousand dollars, then returning to the lounge room a short time later to tell him they were millionaires. 
"I told her not to be stupid," the husband said. 
"When I re-checked the numbers I immediately realised we could afford our next mortgage payment." 
Owner of St Clair Pharmacy & News, where the ticket was bought, George Salib said he was delighted to learn the couple needed the windfall. 
"They were trying to sell their house as they could no longer afford the mortgage repayments," Salib said. 
"It couldn't have gone to a more deserving couple." - watoday.com.au
